quests.title: Warmup Script – First Sparks
quests.summary: Write a tiny CLI script that greets the user and loops a few times.
quests.objective: Get comfortable with variables, functions, and a basic CLI.
tasks: Create a Python script with a main() function.
Parse --name and --times from the command line (argparse or click).
Print a greeting that repeats 'times' times.
Add a simple docstring explaining how to run it.
acceptance_criteria: Running `python script.py --name Leo --times 3` prints 3 greetings.
Script exits with code 0 for valid input.
No obvious style horrors: basic readability and naming.

quests.title: Control the Flame – Branching & Logic
quests.summary: Build a function that classifies temperatures into ranges.
quests.objective: Practice conditionals and returning structured results.
tasks: Implement classify_temperature(celsius: float) -> str.
Return 'cold', 'warm', 'hot', or 'danger' based on thresholds.
Write 4–6 tests covering each range.
acceptance_criteria: Thresholds are clearly defined and documented.
Edge cases (exact thresholds) behave consistently.
Tests pass and live in a separate test file.

quests.title: Collections – Sensor Rollup
quests.summary: Aggregate sensor readings into per-sensor averages.
tasks: Take a list of {sensor_id, value} readings.
Compute the average per sensor_id.
Return a dict mapping sensor_id -> avg_value.
acceptance_criteria: Function handles empty list without crashing.
Multiple sensors with mixed counts are handled correctly.
Uses Pythonic style (dicts, comprehensions) instead of weird manual indexing.

quests.title: Errors & Logging – Keep the Furnace Safe
quests.summary: Wrap parsing code with robust error handling and logging.
quests.objective: Learn to use try/except and the logging module.
tasks: Implement parse_reading(text: str) -> float that may raise.
Wrap it in a helper that catches errors, logs them, and returns None.
Configure logging to print to stderr with levels.
acceptance_criteria: Invalid inputs are logged with helpful messages, not raw tracebacks.
Valid inputs still return correct values.
No bare `except:` without at least logging.

boss.title: Boss: The Furnace Controller
boss.summary: Turn your small scripts into a clean, testable furnace controller CLI.
boss.mission: Build a small module that reads sensor JSON, accepts CLI args, validates them, logs decisions, and exits with meaningful codes.
requirements: CLI with --target-temp and --tolerance flags.
Reads a JSON file of sensor readings passed via --input.
Computes average temp and decides 'HEAT', 'COOL', or 'STABLE'.
Logs key decisions and errors; never crashes with an ugly traceback.
Has at least 3 basic tests for decision logic.

quests.title: CSV Scraper – First Data Tap
quests.summary: Read a CSV of transactions and filter them by criteria.
quests.objective: Use csv / DictReader and simple filtering.
tasks: Read a CSV file of transactions: id, amount, category, created_at.
Return only 'EXPENSE' rows above a configurable minimum.
Expose a simple CLI wrapper: --min-amount, --category.
acceptance_criteria: Uses csv.DictReader or similar, not brittle string splitting.
Filters are tested with at least two different datasets.

quests.title: Frequency Forge – Count the Logs
quests.summary: Aggregate log levels and top offending messages.
tasks: Given a list of log entries with level + message, compute counts by level.
Find the top 3 most common messages.
Return a structured summary dict.
acceptance_criteria: Uses collections.Counter instead of manual nested loops.
Handles tie-breaking and empty inputs gracefully.

quests.title: Grouping – Buckets of Molten Metal
quests.summary: Group items by key and compute aggregates.
quests.objective: Work with dict-of-lists or groupby patterns.
tasks: Group transactions by month and category.
Compute total amount per (month, category).
acceptance_criteria: No duplicated accumulation logic; uses helper functions.
Works if there are multiple months / categories or just one.

boss.title: Boss: The Data Crucible
boss.summary: Build a mini-ETL that ingests CSV + config and outputs aggregated JSON.
boss.mission: Design a small CLI that reads a CSV plus a JSON config describing aggregations, and emits a structured JSON report.
requirements: Config defines group-by fields and aggregation fields.
Supports at least sum + count.
Has tests for at least two different configs.
Handles missing files / malformed config with clean error messages.

quests.title: File IO – Shape the Ingot
quests.summary: Read a text file, normalize lines, and write a cleaned version.
quests.objective: Practice context managers and path handling.
tasks: Use pathlib.Path to build input/output paths.
Strip trailing whitespace and lower-case all lines.
Write to a new file, preserving line count.
acceptance_criteria: Uses `with` statements for file IO.
Handles missing file by raising a clear exception or exiting gracefully.

quests.title: JSON Validation – Inspect the Alloy
quests.summary: Validate JSON records for required keys.
quests.objective: Handle basic validation and error reporting.
tasks: Load JSON list of objects from file.
Ensure each object has required keys: id, value.
Collect and report invalid records.
acceptance_criteria: Does not crash on malformed JSON; surfaces a clear error.
Invalid records are reported with enough context to debug.

quests.title: Config Layer – Control the Furnace
quests.summary: Load config from JSON and override with environment variables.
tasks: Implement load_config(default_path='config.json').
Merge file config with environment overrides (e.g., APP_ENV, APP_LOG_LEVEL).
acceptance_criteria: Environment variables can override file values.
Missing config file leads to sensible defaults instead of a crash.

boss.title: Boss: The Config Anvil
boss.summary: Build a batch job runner with a solid config system.
boss.mission: Create a small batch tool that loads config, runs a multi-step transform, and logs to file + console.
requirements: Config drives input/output paths and at least one behavior flag.
Logging is configurable (log level, optional file).
Core transformation logic is testable in isolation from IO.

quests.title: Hello API – First Endpoint
quests.summary: Create a minimal FastAPI service with health and echo endpoints.
quests.objective: Get comfortable with FastAPI, path operations, and basic models.
tasks: Implement GET /health returning {'status': 'ok'}.
Implement GET /echo?value=... returning the same value.
Add a simple Pydantic model for the health response.
acceptance_criteria: Service starts without errors.
Endpoints respond with correct JSON and status 200.
Basic tests use TestClient or httpx to hit both endpoints.

quests.title: Resource Forge – CRUD in the Foundry
quests.summary: Expose CRUD routes for a simple in-memory resource.
quests.objective: Learn to model resources and implement CRUD semantics.
tasks: Define a Pydantic model for a simple resource (e.g., Quest or Note).
Implement POST/GET/PUT/DELETE for /items.
Store data in-memory (dict) for now.
acceptance_criteria: Returns correct status codes (201 for create, 404 for missing).
Validation errors return 422 or 400 with useful bodies.
Tests cover create → read → update → delete.

quests.title: Validation & Errors – Guard the Ember
quests.summary: Add robust validation and friendly error responses.
quests.objective: Handle bad input gracefully and consistently.
tasks: Add constraints to your Pydantic models (length, ranges).
Customize error messages for common failure modes.
Introduce at least one error-handling dependency or handler.
acceptance_criteria: Bad input no longer yields confusing tracebacks.
Errors return JSON with a clear message and error code.
Tests assert on error behavior, not just success paths.

boss.title: Boss: The Ember Service
boss.summary: Build a small, well-behaved FastAPI service with a real resource, pagination, and tests.
boss.mission: Expose a resource with at least 3 fields, support listing with filtering/pagination, and provide thorough tests for success + error paths.
requirements: RESTful routes for the resource (create/read/update/delete/list).
Pagination or basic filtering on list endpoint.
Validation for required fields and basic constraints.
Test suite that covers happy paths and key error paths.
Reasonable structure (routers, schemas, main app) instead of one giant file.

quests.title: Async Fanout – Fetch Many Sparks
quests.summary: Fetch multiple URLs concurrently with async/await.
quests.objective: Use asyncio + httpx.AsyncClient to parallelize work.
tasks: Implement fetch_many(urls: list[str]) -> list[Result].
Handle timeouts and network errors gracefully.
acceptance_criteria: Concurrent fetching is actually faster than sequential.
Errors for some URLs don't kill the whole batch.

quests.title: Job Queue – Ember Workers
quests.summary: Create an in-memory job queue and background worker.
quests.objective: Practice scheduling, state, and error handling.
tasks: Add endpoint to enqueue jobs.
Worker processes jobs in background, recording status.
Expose endpoint to inspect job status.
acceptance_criteria: Jobs survive minor errors and are marked failed when appropriate.
Tests simulate a few jobs and check their final state.

boss.title: Boss: The Ember Worker
boss.summary: Design a small job-processing subsystem with async workers and metrics.
boss.mission: Build a worker that processes queued jobs, captures errors, and exposes basic metrics endpoint.
requirements: Job submission endpoint with validation.
Worker that processes jobs concurrently, with a max concurrency cap.
Metrics endpoint summarizing successes/failures.
Tests that simulate error cases (timeouts, exceptions).

quests.title: Package Skeleton – Name Your Tool
quests.summary: Turn a script into a proper Python package.
quests.objective: Set up pyproject.toml, src layout, and imports.
tasks: Create pyproject.toml with project metadata.
Move code into src/<package_name>/.
Adjust imports and verify tests still pass.
acceptance_criteria: Package installs locally with `pip install -e .`.
Entry point still works after refactor.

quests.title: CLI Entrypoint – Forge Handle
quests.summary: Expose a console script for your tool.
tasks: Add a console_scripts entrypoint in pyproject.
Wrap core logic in a main() that handles arguments and exit codes.
acceptance_criteria: Running the command from shell works without touching python directly.
Non-zero exit codes for error conditions.

quests.title: Lint & Test – Temper the Steel
quests.summary: Add ruff/black/pytest and fix basic issues.
quests.objective: Establish a baseline of code quality.
tasks: Configure ruff and black.
Add pytest and one or two tests for core logic.
Add a simple CI job configuration file.
acceptance_criteria: Lint and tests pass locally.
CI config is syntactically valid and runs tests.

boss.title: Boss: The Foundry Toolchain
boss.summary: Ship a reusable tool with packaging, tests, and CI.
boss.mission: Turn a small utility into a production-ready package with a CLI, tests, and a CI pipeline.
requirements: Installable package with console script.
Basic test suite and lint configuration.
CI config that runs tests and lint on push/PR.
README that explains how to install and use the tool.
